memberdef.name: packMsg

briefdescription.para: Pack a message, used by the system.

internal.para: Packs bytes directly after a message into a single contiguous buffer to send. The message better have sufficient space allocated after the message to pack these bytes. This is often used when the memory pool slot selected comes with some extra space instead of sending two separate buffers.

parameterdescription.para: message to pack
size of message
pointer to pack
bytes at pointer to pack

simplesect.para: the new size of the message

memberdef.argsstring: (EpochType const &epoch)
memberdef.name: pushEpoch

briefdescription.para: Push an epoch on the stack.

internal.para: Pushes any epoch onto the local stack iff epoch != no_epoch; the epoch stack includes all locally pushed epochs and the current contexts pushed, transitively causally related active message handlers.

parameterdescription.para: the epoch to push

memberdef.argsstring: (EpochType const &epoch=no_epoch)
memberdef.name: popEpoch

briefdescription.para: Pop an epoch off the stack.

internal.para: Shall remove the top entry from epoch_size_, iff the size is non-zero and the epoch passed, if epoch != no_epoch, is equal to the top of the epoch_stack_.top(); else, it shall remove any entry from the top of the stack.

parameterdescription.para: the epoch that is expected to exist on the stack

simplesect.para: the epoch popped off the stack

memberdef.argsstring: () const
memberdef.name: getEpoch

briefdescription.para: Returns the top of the epoch stack.

simplesect.para: the epoch on the top of the stack

memberdef.argsstring: (MsgT *msg)
memberdef.name: getEpochContextMsg

briefdescription.para: Get the epoch for a message based on the current context so an subsequent operation on it can be safely delayed.

parameterdescription.para: the message to set the epoch on

simplesect.para: the epoch on the message or from context

memberdef.argsstring: (MsgSharedPtr< MsgT > const &msg)
memberdef.name: getEpochContextMsg

briefdescription.para: Get the epoch for a message based on the current context so an subsequent operation on it can be safely delayed.

simplesect.para: the epoch on the message or from context

memberdef.argsstring: (MsgT *msg)
memberdef.name: setupEpochMsg

briefdescription.para: Set the epoch on a message.

internal.para: The method finds the current epoch based on whether its already set on the message (which in that case it uses the one on the message already) or obtains the current epoch from the epoch stack based on the handler that is running

parameterdescription.para: the message to get/set the epoch on

simplesect.para: the epoch set

memberdef.argsstring: (MsgSharedPtr< MsgT > const &msg)
memberdef.name: setupEpochMsg

briefdescription.para: Set the epoch on th message.

parameterdescription.para: the message to get/set the epoch on

simplesect.para: the epoch set

memberdef.argsstring: (MultiMsg *msg)
memberdef.name: chunkedMultiMsg

briefdescription.para: Handle a control message; immediately calls handleChunkedMultiMsg.

parameterdescription.para: the message with control data

briefdescription.para: Core component of VT used to send messages.

detaileddescription.para: ActiveMessenger is a core VT component that provides the ability to send messages Message to registered handlers. It manages the incoming and outgoing messages using MPI to communicate MPI_Irecv and MPI_Isend

Calls that send messages, such as sendMsg and broadcastMsg, relinquish ownership of the message supplied. This is implied regardless of the type of the message argument. This implicit behavior is equivalent to the explicit use of std::move.
The following two code snippets have the same semantics:
It is invalid to attempt to access the messages after such calls, and doing so may result in a vtAssert or undefined behavior. In special cases promoteMsg can be used to acquire secondary ownership.

There are various ways to send messages:
Send Message Active Function (type-safe handler)
Basic Active Message Send with Pre-Registered Handler
Send Message BASIC Active Function
Send Message to Functor Variants
Send Data Message with data payload
